extends DBConnection

    class to write data into a database

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBcrawler

        public DBcrawler(AccessData accessData,
         java.util.logging.Logger logger)
          throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                 java.sql.SQLException
        configure the connection to the database
        Parameters:
        accessData - the access data to the specified mysql-database as AccessData
        logger - a global logger for the whole program as Logger
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if a database-connection couldn't be established now

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        public boolean[] addAccount(twitter4j.User user,
                   java.lang.String location,
                   java.util.Date date,
                   boolean tweet)
        Description copied from interface: DBIcrawler
        insert an account into the database
        Specified by:
        addAccount in interface DBIcrawler
        Parameters:
        user - the user to add as User
        location - the location of the account as String
        date - the date of the tweet as Date
        tweet - true if a tweet status object has been read, false if a retweets status object has been read
        Returns:
        boolean-array with three results of the database requests. First is the result of adding the location, second is result for adding the account and third is for adding the tweet.

      • addRetweet

        public boolean[] addRetweet(long id,
                   java.lang.String location,
                   java.util.Date date)
        Description copied from interface: DBIcrawler
        inserts a retweet into the database, if it's still in the database the counter will be increased
        Specified by:
        addRetweet in interface DBIcrawler
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the account who's tweet was retweeted as long
        location - the location of the retweet as String (null if could not been localized)
        date - the day when the retweet has been written as Date
        Returns:
        database-request result as Boolean[]

        Specified by:

      • addLocationString

        public boolean addLocationString(java.lang.String code,
                        java.lang.String word,
                        java.lang.String timeZone)
        Description copied from interface: DBIcrawler
        inserts a location-code - word combination to the database
        Specified by:
        addLocationString in interface DBIcrawler
        Parameters:
        code - the location-code as String (max. length 3)
        word - the word to connect with the location-code as String (max. length 250)
        timeZone - the timezone of the location as String (max. length 200)
        Returns:
        true if data has been insert into the database, else false
